channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: See Spot run: Photos from a historic Puppy Bowl
item.description: The pups from Team Fluff weren't the only winners. See freeze-frame highlights from the 21st edition of the Puppy Bowl.
item.content:encoded:
The pups from Team Fluff weren't the only winners. See freeze-frame highlights from the 21st edition of the Puppy Bowl.

(Image credit: Ryan Muir)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Kendrick Lamar and SZA perform at the Super Bowl Halftime Show in New Orleans
item.description: With the biggest captive audience of his career -- around 80,000 fans in the Superdome and millions more at home — Lamar's performance will conjure a medley of hits that could span his 15-year discography, and will feature R&B star SZA as a special guest.
item.content:encoded:
With the biggest captive audience of his career -- around 80,000 fans in the Superdome and millions more at home — Lamar's performance will conjure a medley of hits that could span his 15-year discography, and will feature R&B star SZA as a special guest.

(Image credit: Cindy Ord)
item.dc:creator: Sidney Madden

item.title: The best (and worst) Super Bowl commercials... so far
item.description: At a time when every fresh news alert seems to deliver a new seismic jolt about the world – the ads featured in this year's Super Bowl mostly touch on safe subjects we traditionally expect in Big Game commercials: Nostalgia. Comedy. Celebrities. Patriotism. And poignant humanism.
item.content:encoded:
At a time when every fresh news alert seems to deliver a new seismic jolt about the world – the ads featured in this year's Super Bowl mostly touch on safe subjects we traditionally expect in Big Game commercials: Nostalgia. Comedy. Celebrities. Patriotism. And poignant humanism.

(Image credit: Screenshot from Häagen-Dazs ad)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: Bestselling novelist Tom Robbins dies at 92
item.description: Robbins dazzled readers with the whimsy and imagination in his books, including Jitterbug Perfume, Skinny Legs and All and Even Cowgirls Get the Blues.
item.content:encoded: Robbins dazzled readers with the whimsy and imagination in his books, including Jitterbug Perfume, Skinny Legs and All and Even Cowgirls Get the Blues.
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: Trump defends Elon Musk as 'terrific' during Super Bowl interview
item.description: President Trump calls federal courts blocking Elon Musk "crazy," and predicted the Kansas City Chiefs would win Super Bowl LIX.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump calls federal courts blocking Elon Musk "crazy," and predicted the Kansas City Chiefs would win Super Bowl LIX.

(Image credit: Fox News)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Snow and ice blanket parts of the northern U.S., and more winter weather is on the way
item.description: A mix of snow and ice blanketed a large swath of the northern U.S. over the weekend, after a major winter storm hit parts of the Upper Midwest, the Great Lakes region and the Northeast.
item.content:encoded:
A mix of snow and ice blanketed a large swath of the northern U.S. over the weekend, after a major winter storm hit parts of the Upper Midwest, the Great Lakes region and the Northeast.

(Image credit: Scott Eisen)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Trump 2.0 or Project 2025?
item.description:
Project 2025, is a 900-plus page blueprint for a conservative President. It was unveiled in the spring of 2023, well before Donald Trump had won the republican presidential nomination.

It outlined a suite of very conservative policies that would, for example, outlaw the mailing of abortion pills and abolish the department of education. It even suggests a return to the gold standard.

It became a democratic talking point, so much so that Trump repeatedly distanced himself from the plan and the authors.

But now that Trump is in office, releasing his own detailed plans. A lot of them are strikingly similar to the ones laid out in Project 2025. And one of its chief architects is now the head of the critical Office of Management and Budget.

Trump disavowed Project 2025 during the campaign. Now, as President, is he using it as a playbook?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org
item.content:encoded:
Project 2025, is a 900-plus page blueprint for a conservative President. It was unveiled in the spring of 2023, well before Donald Trump had won the republican presidential nomination.

It outlined a suite of very conservative policies that would, for example, outlaw the mailing of abortion pills and abolish the department of education. It even suggests a return to the gold standard.

It became a democratic talking point, so much so that Trump repeatedly distanced himself from the plan and the authors.

But now that Trump is in office, releasing his own detailed plans. A lot of them are strikingly similar to the ones laid out in Project 2025. And one of its chief architects is now the head of the critical Office of Management and Budget.

Trump disavowed Project 2025 during the campaign. Now, as President, is he using it as a playbook?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

item.title: Searching the entire sky for the secrets to our universe
item.description: A new telescope could launch as early as late February. SPHEREx will look into deep space and also search for organic molecules.
item.content:encoded:
A new telescope could launch as early as late February. SPHEREx will look into deep space and also search for organic molecules.

(Image credit: BAE Systems/NASA/JPL-Caltech)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Egypt to host Gaza summit as Israel withdraws troops from Netzarim Corridor
item.description: A statement by the Egyptian foreign ministry said the leaders will gather on Feb. 27 amid alarm in the region over President Trump's proposals regarding the future of Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
A statement by the Egyptian foreign ministry said the leaders will gather on Feb. 27 amid alarm in the region over President Trump's proposals regarding the future of Gaza.

(Image credit: Youssef Alzanoun)
item.dc:creator: Jerome Socolovsky

item.title: Super Bowl 2025: The Philadelphia Eagles lead the Kansas City Chiefs at the end of the 2nd quarter
item.description: The Kansas City Chiefs meet the Philadelphia Eagles Sunday for a date with history. The Chiefs are trying to become the first NFL team ever to win three Super Bowls in a row.
item.content:encoded:
The Kansas City Chiefs meet the Philadelphia Eagles Sunday for a date with history. The Chiefs are trying to become the first NFL team ever to win three Super Bowls in a row.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff
